summary: The document is a declassified message related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, focusing on individuals with connections to Cuba, including COL. ORLANDO and EVELIO ALPIZAR PEREZ. It outlines their backgrounds, activities, and potential ties to intelligence services, detailing their roles in Cuba, migration to the U.S., and alleged post-migration activities. The document also references FBI reports and interviews concerning these individuals and seeks approval to share their information with the FBI to assist in investigations.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It provides detailed backgrounds and activities of two individuals linked to Cuba and the Batista regime.
Suggests potential intelligence connections and activities aimed at influencing Cuban politics after the Batista era.
Includes a request to share information about these individuals with the FBI to support investigations.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
